blogs.title: Europe Steps Up to the Challenge of Digital Competition Law
blogs.summary:
Two years ago U.S. authorities abandoned a critical case in digital antitrust. The EC now appears ready to fill the void: 
The European Commission is said to be planning to charge Google with using its dominant position in online search to favor the compan

blogs.title: What Happened When Dylann Roof Asked Google For Information About Race?
blogs.summary: The 22-year-old said in court documents that the results of a Google search shaped his beliefs on race years before he murdered nine people in a historically black South Carolina church.(Image credit: AP)

author.name: Technology
author.description: Latest technology news and breakthroughs in technology, science, and industry. Download the NPR Technology podcast and Technology RSS feed.

news.title: Why Europe needs a digital regulator
news.summary: Citizens, governments and technology startups deserve a regulator to keep the monopolistic instincts of the Googles, Facebooks, Amazons and Apples at bay Continue reading...

news.title: What Happened When Dylann Roof Asked Google For Information About Race?
news.summary: This undated photo appeared on a website investigated by the FBI in connection with Dylann Roof, who killed nine people in a Charleston, S.C., church in June 2015.

news.title: What Happened When Dylann Roof Asked Google For Information About Race?
news.summary: Dylann Roof murdered nine people in a church basement in Charleston in 2015. He confessed to the massacre shortly after he was arrested.
